intro: Tithymalus flavicomus subsp. costeanus, commonly known as the Costeanus tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is a relatively rare subspecies and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
